Class bartMachine_b_hyperparams

java.lang.Object
bartMachine.Classifier
bartMachine.bartMachine_a_base
bartMachine.bartMachine_b_hyperparams
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
bartMachine_c_debug
public abstract class bartMachine_b_hyperparams extends bartMachine_a_base implements Serializable
This portion of the code controls hyperparameters for the BART algorithm as well as properties and transformations of the response variable.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class Classifier

    Classifier.ErrorTypes

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected double
    alpha
    A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree independent of depth
    protected double
    beta
    A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree dependent on depth which makes it more difficult as the tree gets deeper
    protected double[]
    depth_prior_log_ratio_table
    A cached table of the depth-dependent part of the tree prior log-ratio
    protected double
    hyper_k
    this controls where to set hyper_sigsq_mu by forcing the variance to be this number of standard deviations on the normal CDF
    protected double
    hyper_lambda
    the multiplier of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
    protected double
    hyper_mu_mu
    the center of the prior of the terminal node prediction distribution
    protected double
    hyper_nu
    half the shape parameter and half the multiplicand of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
    protected double
    hyper_q
    At a fixed hyper_nu, this controls where to set hyper_lambda by forcing q proportion to be at that value in the inverse gamma CDF
    protected double
    hyper_sigsq_mu
    the variance of the prior of the terminal node prediction distribution
    protected HashMap<Integer, it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntOpenHashSet>
    interaction_constraints
    if a covariate is a key here, the value defines interaction between the variables that are legal
    protected double
    log_sigsq
    Cached log(sigsq)
    protected double[]
    log_sigsq_plus_n_sigsq_mu_table
    A cached table of log(sigsq + n * hyper_sigsq_mu) for n = 0 to N
    protected double[]
    log_table
    A cached table of log(i) for i = 0 to max(N, P)
    protected Double
    sample_var_y
    the sample variance of the response variable on its original scale
    protected static double[]
    samps_chi_sq_df_eq_nu_plus_n
    A cached library of chi-squared with degrees of freedom nu plus n (used for Gibbs sampling the variance)
    protected static int
    samps_chi_sq_df_eq_nu_plus_n_length
    The number of samples in the cached library of chi-squared values
    protected static double[]
    samps_std_normal
    A cached library of standard normal values (used for Gibbs sampling the posterior means of the terminal nodes)
    protected static int
    samps_std_normal_length
    The number of samples in the cached library of standard normal values
    protected double
    y_max
    the maximum of the response variable on its original scale
    protected double
    y_min
    the minimum of the response variable on its original scale
    protected double
    y_range_sq
    the minimum of the response variable on its original scale
    protected static final double
    YminAndYmaxHalfDiff
    The static field that controls the bounds on the transformed y variable which is between negative and positive this value

      protected double hyper_k
      this controls where to set hyper_sigsq_mu by forcing the variance to be this number of standard deviations on the normal CDF

    • hyper_q

      protected double hyper_q
      At a fixed hyper_nu, this controls where to set hyper_lambda by forcing q proportion to be at that value in the inverse gamma CDF

    • transformResponseVariable

      protected void transformResponseVariable()
      Computes the transformed y variable using the procedure outlined in the following paper: See HA Chipman, EI George, and RE McCulloch. BART: Bayesian Additive Regressive Trees. The Annals of Applied Statistics, 4(1): 266-298, 2010.
      Overrides:
      transformResponseVariable in class Classifier
